Use bsub package on the DKFZ ODCF cluster

Source: vignettes/dkfz_odcf.Rmd
dkfz_odcf.Rmd

Author: Zuguang Gu ( z.gu@dkfz.de )

Date: 2020-02-12

On odcf-worker01

You can submit and monitor jobs by entering commands (under command-line mode), but you cannot use the interactive job monitor (because web browser is not available on odcf-worker01).

On B080/W610 pc

You will be asked for the password for connecting to the submission node via ssh. Don’t submit the jobs there because the file system is different from that on the submission nodes. You can open the interactive job monitor by monitor(). You might have the following problem saying you cannot open the web browser:

monitor()
# Listening on http://127.0.0.1:5298
# Couldn't get a file descriptor referring to the console

You can directly copy http://127.0.0.1:5298 (the port can be different for you) and paste it to the web browser, or you need to set the global option for finding the browser:

options("browser" = Sys.which("firefox"))
monitor()  # now firefox will be automatically opened.

On your own laptop

You need to connect VPN first, and then load the ODCF configuration:

bsub:::config_odcf(your_user_name)

After that you can use the interactive job monitor.

On Rstudio server/computing nodes

You can submit jobs, and also monitor your jobs with the interactive job monitor.

Developed by Zuguang Gu.
